intro: Tetramicra pratensis, commonly known as the meadow tetramicra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a small herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and damp woodlands. The plant features slender stems with opposite, pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Tetramicra pratensis is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
